Key Match Events: Mark Adair took the first wicket of Ryan Rickelton in the first over
Rassie van der Dussen was trapped lbw by Mark Adair
Reeza Hendricks was edged by Graham Hume to Andy Balbirnie at second slip
Kyle Verreynne was trapped lbw by Craig Young
Tristan Stubbs was caught by Fionn Hand
Bjorn Fortuin was bowled by left-arm spinner Matthew Humphreys
Andile Phehlukwayo was caught by fine leg to give Fionn Hand a first ODI wicket on debut
Jason Smith scored his first international fifty but in vain
Lungi Ngidi was caught by Tucker behind
Post-Match Reflections: Half-centuries from captain Paul Stirling and Harry Tector, and an all-round bowling effort helped Ireland to a consolation win in the third ODI against South Africa
Jason Smith, playing his second ODI, made a fighting 91 but it was an effort in vain after Ireland had run through South Africa's top five inside 20 overs
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland built their score on the back of Stirling and Andy Balbirnie's first 100-plus partnership in ODIs
Paul Stirling and Andy Balbirnie put up a solid opening partnership
Lorcan Tucker, fit again and back in the side, kept Ireland ticking alongside Harry Tector
Curtis Campher started quickly, picking two boundaries off a Williams over before clubbing Fortuin over wide long-on for six
Graham Hume wrapped up the win when he had Lungi Ngidi edging behind with 23 balls to go
Others: Ireland won the toss for the first time in the series
Ireland's quicks made early inroads after their batters got them to a competitive total
With the new ball swinging appreciably more under lights than in the last two games, Ireland's quicks made early inroads
Abhimanyu Bose is a sub-editor with ESPNcricinfo
